root.name: Brain Breaker
root.description: OverviewBrain Breaker is an epic open-world platform-adventure for the Sharp X1 Japanese home computer. It was designed by Hiroshi Ishikawa, who worked on its development since Spring 1984, and published by Enix in 1985. The game was in some ways a precursor to Nintendo's famous Metroid series, the first entry of which was released a year later in 1986.
